hero.subtitle: Regain your ability to chew, speak, and smile with confidence. Modern, long-lasting solutions for missing teeth.
hero.imageAlt: Dental implants and prosthetics at Dr. S√≠lvio Ara√∫jo Clinic

servicesSection.title: Solutions for Missing Teeth

implantes.title: Dental Implants
implantes.description: A permanent, natural solution to replace missing teeth. Implants are artificial titanium roots that support dental crowns.

fixas.title: Fixed Prosthetics
fixas.description: Fixed bridges and crowns cemented on natural teeth or implants, providing maximum stability and comfort.

removiveis.title: Removable Prosthetics
removiveis.description: Flexible and affordable removable solutions to replace multiple teeth, using high-quality materials.

processSection.title: The Implant Placement Process
processSection.subtitle: A well-planned treatment for exceptional results.

01.title: Initial Assessment
01.description: Comprehensive exam with X-rays and CT scan to assess bone structure.

02.title: Digital Planning
02.description: Creation of a personalized treatment plan using 3D technology.

03.title: Placement Surgery
03.description: Minimally invasive procedure to place the implant.

04.title: Healing Period
04.description: 3-6 months for complete osseointegration of the implant into the bone.

05.title: Crown Placement
05.description: Installation of the final crown, customized for your smile.

1.a: The procedure is performed with local anesthesia and is usually virtually painless. Post-operative discomfort is generally mild and controlled with medication.

2.q: How long does an implant last?
2.a: With proper care, an implant can last a lifetime. The success rate is above 95%.

3.q: Can I get implants if I have little bone?
3.a: Yes. There are bone graft techniques and special implants for cases of bone resorption.

higiene.title: How to maintain good daily oral hygiene
higiene.description: Practical habits for healthier teeth and gums: brushing technique, flossing, mouthwash, diet, and when to see the dentist.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Need a personalized plan? We can assess your routine and recommend the best products and techniques.

higiene.lead: Small daily habits make a big difference. Here's a practical guide to keep your teeth and gums healthy ‚Äî at home and between appointments.
higiene.keyTakeaway1: Brush 2√ó a day (2 min) + interdental cleaning
higiene.whyText1: Oral health goes beyond aesthetics. Gum disease and cavities can cause pain and tooth loss, and are associated with systemic conditions such as cardiovascular disease and diabetes.
higiene.whyText2: The good news? Prevention is simple with the right habits. Here's what really makes a difference.

step1.title: Morning and night: brush for 2 minutes
step1.text: Use fluoride toothpaste and a soft-bristled toothbrush. Cover all surfaces ‚Äî outer, inner, and chewing surfaces.

step2.title: Interdental cleaning (1√ó a day)
step2.text: Use dental floss or interdental brushes. Ideally at night, before brushing.

step3.title: Optional: mouthwash/rinse
step3.text: Use only if recommended by your dentist. It does not replace brushing or interdental cleaning.

step4.title: Hydration and less sugar
step4.text: Drink water throughout the day. Avoid snacking between meals, especially sugary foods.

higiene.tech1: Hold the toothbrush at a 45¬∞ angle to the gumline (where the tooth meets the gum).
higiene.tech2: Use short, gentle strokes ‚Äî avoid brushing too hard.
higiene.tech3: Brush the outer, inner, and chewing surfaces of all teeth.
higiene.tech4: Gently brush your tongue (or use a tongue scraper) to reduce bacteria and improve breath.
higiene.flossSectionText: Cavities and gum problems often start between teeth. If floss is difficult, interdental brushes can be an excellent alternative ‚Äî ask your dentist for the right size.
higiene.flossHow1: Gently slide between teeth and form a ‚ÄúC‚Äù shape around the tooth.
higiene.flossHow2: Move up and down, cleaning both sides of the tooth.
higiene.flossHow3: Use a clean section of floss for each interdental space.

diet.good3: Chew sugar-free gum after meals (if appropriate) to stimulate saliva.
diet.limit2: Sipping soda/juice slowly over a long time (constant acidic exposure).
diet.limit3: Tobacco (high risk for gum disease and staining).

higiene.warningSubtitle: If you notice any of these signs, consider scheduling an evaluation:

warning.1: Gum bleeding when brushing or flossing
warning.5: Pain when chewing or jaw discomfort

faq.q1: If my gums bleed, should I stop flossing?
faq.a1: Usually, no. Bleeding is often a sign of inflammation. Floss gently and consistently; if it persists for 1‚Äì2 weeks, schedule an evaluation.
faq.a2: Not always. It can help in specific situations (gingivitis, high cavity risk). The foundation is brushing + interdental cleaning.
faq.q3: Electric toothbrush: is it worth it?
faq.a3: For many people, yes ‚Äî it improves consistency and plaque removal. Technique still matters.

finalCta.title: Want a personalized oral hygiene plan?
finalCta.text: We can assess gum health, cavity risk, and recommend products and techniques tailored to you.

implantes.title: Dental implants: complete guide
implantes.description: Everything you need to know about dental implants, from the procedure to recovery. A complete guide to implantology.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want to restore your smile? Schedule a free evaluation to see if implants are right for you.

implantes.lead: Dental implants are the most modern and effective solution for replacing missing teeth. They work as artificial roots that support crowns, bridges, or dentures, providing natural and long-lasting results.

takeaways.title: Key takeaways
takeaways.two: Can last a lifetime with proper care
takeaways.three: Preserve the jawbone and adjacent teeth

implantes.whatText: A dental implant is a small titanium screw that is surgically inserted into the upper or lower jawbone. Titanium is biocompatible, meaning the body accepts it and bone grows around it, creating a solid base for the new tooth.

implant.title: Implant
implant.text: Titanium screw placed in the bone

abutment.title: Abutment
abutment.text: Connector piece between implant and crown

advantages.2: Durability ‚Äî can last a lifetime with proper care
advantages.6: Do not need to be removed for cleaning
advantages.7: Improve self-esteem and quality of life

implantes.eligibilityText1: Most adults in good overall health can receive dental implants. However, a careful evaluation is required to determine if you are a good candidate.
implantes.eligibilityText2: Factors that can affect eligibility include:

eligibility.1: Amount and quality of available bone
eligibility.2: General health and medical conditions (diabetes, osteoporosis)

phase1.title: Phase 1: Assessment and planning
phase1.text: The dentist performs detailed clinical and radiographic exams, including a 3D CT scan, to assess the bone and plan the ideal implant position.

phase2.title: Phase 2: Implant placement
phase2.text: Under local anesthesia, the implant is placed in the bone. The procedure is usually painless. A temporary tooth may be placed the same day (immediate loading) in selected cases.

phase3.title: Phase 3: Osseointegration
phase3.text: Over 3 to 6 months, the bone integrates with the implant. This period is crucial for long-term success.

phase4.title: Phase 4: Final crown placement
phase4.text: After healing, the abutment and the final crown are placed, custom-made to match your natural teeth.

implantes.recoveryText: Initial recovery lasts a few days to a week. During this period:

recovery.1: There may be some swelling and mild discomfort
recovery.3: Avoid hard foods on the treated area

implantes.successText: Dental implants have a success rate above 95% when placed by experienced professionals with proper care. With regular maintenance, they can last a lifetime.
implantes.costText: The cost varies depending on the number of implants, crown type, and any additional procedures needed (such as bone grafting). We offer financing options to make treatment accessible.

finalCta.title: Want to restore your smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule a free evaluation to see if dental implants are the ideal solution for you.

estetica.title: All about teeth whitening
estetica.description: Learn about the different types of teeth whitening and which one is best for you. A complete guide to dental aesthetics.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Want a whiter smile? Schedule an evaluation to find out which whitening option is best for you.

estetica.lead: Teeth whitening is one of the most requested aesthetic procedures in dental clinics. A whiter smile can significantly boost confidence and improve overall facial appearance.

takeaways.title: Key takeaways
takeaways.one: Professional whitening is safe and effective
takeaways.two: Results can last from 1 to 3 years

estetica.causesText: Teeth can darken for various reasons over time. Understanding the causes helps prevention and choosing the most appropriate treatment.

food.title: Food and drinks
food.text: Coffee, tea, red wine, and colored soft drinks

tobacco.title: Tobacco
tobacco.text: Smoke is one of the main causes of tooth staining

age.title: Age
age.text: Enamel naturally wears down, revealing the more yellow dentin

medication.title: Medication
medication.text: Certain antibiotics and treatments can cause discoloration

office.title: 1. In-office whitening
office.text: Performed by the dentist, it uses higher-concentration whitening agents, providing visible results in a single session. It is the fastest and most effective method.

home.title: 2. Supervised at-home whitening
home.text: The dentist makes custom trays and provides whitening gel for home use. It is a more affordable and comfortable option, although results take longer to appear.
home.application: Application: A few hours per day or overnight
home.advantage: Advantage: Can touch up when needed

combined.title: 3. Combined whitening
combined.text: Combines an in-office session with at-home maintenance, offering the best of both methods: fast and long-lasting results.

estetica.safetyText: Yes, when performed or supervised by a qualified dentist. The products used in clinics are safe and tested. Some temporary sensitivity may occur, which typically disappears after treatment.

aftercare.1: Avoid strongly colored foods and drinks in the first 48 hours
aftercare.2: Do not smoke during the treatment period
aftercare.4: Visit the dentist regularly for maintenance

estetica.durationText: Results can last from 1 to 3 years, depending on diet, oral hygiene, and lifestyle. Periodic maintenance treatments help extend the effect.

faq.a1: When performed by a professional and properly indicated, whitening is safe. Temporary sensitivity may occur, but it should not damage enamel.
faq.a2: Whitening gel works on natural teeth. Restorations do not change color, so some may need replacement to match the final shade.
faq.a3: Some sensitivity during or after treatment is common. The dentist may recommend a desensitizing gel and adjust concentration/duration.

finalCta.title: Want a whiter smile?
finalCta.text: Schedule an evaluation to find out which whitening option is best for you.

odontopediatria.title: When should you take children to the dentist?
odontopediatria.description: Find out the ideal age for the first appointment and how to prepare your little ones for a positive dental experience.

toc.title: In this article
toc.note: Our team is ready to welcome your little ones with lots of care and attention.

odontopediatria.lead: Children‚Äôs oral health is essential for their development. Many parents wonder when to take their children to the dentist for the first time and how to make it a positive experience.
odontopediatria.imageAlt: Child at the dentist with parents
odontopediatria.idealAgeTitle: What is the ideal age for the first appointment?
odontopediatria.idealAgeText: The first dental visit should happen when the first tooth erupts or, at the latest, by the child‚Äôs first birthday. This first appointment is essential to:

idealAge.3: Guide parents on children‚Äôs oral hygiene
idealAge.4: Build a positive relationship between the child and the dentist

odontopediatria.preparationTitle: How to prepare your child for the appointment

2.title: Read books:
2.text: There are children's stories about going to the dentist

3.title: Play dentist:
3.text: Role-play an appointment at home with toys

4.title: Choose the right time:
4.text: Prefer times when your child is rested

during.2: Let the dentist communicate directly with the child
during.4: Praise the child‚Äôs behavior after the appointment

bottle.title: Baby bottle tooth decay
bottle.text: Occurs when a child falls asleep with a bottle of milk or juice in their mouth. To prevent it, clean teeth after each feeding and avoid sugary drinks in bottles.

thumb.title: Thumb sucking
thumb.text: It is natural in the early years, but should be discouraged after age 4 to avoid changes in tooth positioning and arch development.

trauma.title: Dental trauma
trauma.text: Falls and accidents are common in childhood. In case of dental trauma, see a dentist immediately, even if there appears to be no visible damage.

0to2.title: 0-2 years
0to2.text: Clean gums with a moist gauze pad. When the first teeth appear, use a baby toothbrush with water.

2to6.title: 2-6 years
2to6.text: Use fluoride toothpaste (a pea-sized amount). Parents should supervise and help with brushing.

6plus.title: 6+ years
6plus.text: The child can brush alone, but parents should check. Introduce flossing when teeth start touching.

odontopediatria.frequencyTitle: How often should you go to the dentist?
odontopediatria.frequencyText: After the first appointment, it is recommended to visit the dentist every 6 months for routine check-ups. This frequency helps detect and treat issues early, when they are easier to solve.

finalCta.title: Is it time for your child's first appointment?
finalCta.text: Our team is ready to welcome your little ones with lots of care and attention.

faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about our services
faq.description: Find answers to the most common questions about our services.

hours.a: We are open Monday to Friday from 9am to 7pm, and Saturdays from 9am to 1pm. We are closed on Sundays and public holidays.

appointment.q: How can I book an appointment?
appointment.a: You can book through our website by clicking 'Book Appointment', by calling our phone number, or by sending a message via WhatsApp. We can usually schedule appointments within 48 hours.

payments.q: What payment methods do you accept?
payments.a: We accept cash, Multibanco, credit/debit cards (Visa, Mastercard), MB Way, and bank transfer. We also offer flexible payment options for more extensive treatments.

insurance.q: Do you work with health insurance?
insurance.a: Yes, we work with the main insurers in Portugal. Please contact us with your insurance details so we can confirm coverage and procedures.

routine_duration.q: How long does a routine appointment take?
routine_duration.a: A routine appointment (check-up and cleaning) usually takes 45 to 60 minutes. For the first visit, we recommend allowing about 90 minutes to include a full assessment and planning.

pain.a: We use modern anesthesia and sedation techniques to ensure maximum comfort. Most of our patients report little to no discomfort during procedures. We prioritize your well-being in every treatment.

kids_first_visit.q: At what age should I bring my child to the dentist?
kids_first_visit.a: We recommend the first dental visit right after the first tooth erupts, or at the latest by the first birthday. Early visits help establish good oral health habits and prevent future problems.

implant_duration.q: How long does an implant treatment take?
implant_duration.a: The full process typically takes 3 to 6 months, depending on the case. This includes implant placement, healing (osseointegration), and final crown placement. In some cases, we can offer immediate loading solutions.

whitening.a: Yes, professional teeth whitening is completely safe when performed by qualified professionals. We use approved products and techniques that protect enamel and gums, delivering safe and long-lasting results.

booking.q: Do I need to pay in advance to reserve?
booking.a: No advance payment is required for routine appointments. For more complex treatments that require specific preparation, a deposit may be requested. We will always inform you in advance if that is the case.

cta.text: Didn't find the answer you were looking for?

contact.title: Come
contact.description: We are located in Quinta do Conde, with easy access and nearby parking. Get in touch with us.

cta.title: Book Your Appointment Today!
cta.description: Don't wait any longer to take care of your smile. Our team is ready to welcome you.
